description: Conan C/C++ packages. The purl is designed to closely resemble the Conan-native <package-name>/<package-version>@<user>/<channel> syntax for package references as specified in https://docs.conan.io/en/1.46/cheatsheet.html#package-terminology

repository.note: Conan packages are primarily hosted on the Conan Center

qualifiers_definition.description: The Conan <user>. Only required if the Conan package was published with <user>.
The Conan <channel>. Only required if the Conan package was published with Conan <channel>.
The Conan recipe revision (optional). If omitted, the purl refers to the latest recipe revision available for the given version.
The Conan package revision (optional). If omitted, the purl refers to the latest package revision available for the given version and recipe revision.
Compiler used to build the package.
Whether the package is built as a shared library.

common_patterns.description: Conan package with vendor, user, and channel
Conan package with build configuration qualifiers

steps.question: Is there a vendor/namespace component?
steps.yes: Extract the vendor (first component after pkg:conan/)

steps.question: Is there a package name component?
steps.yes: Extract the package name (component after vendor/ or after pkg:conan/ if no vendor)
steps.no: Invalid PURL - package name is required for conan

steps.question: Is there a version component?
steps.no: Invalid PURL - version is required for conan

context.revision_system: Supports both recipe and package revisions

edge_cases.handling: Vendor is optional and can be omitted
edge_cases.purl_impact: Simplifies PURLs for packages without a clear vendor

edge_cases.handling: Build options are represented as qualifiers
edge_cases.purl_impact: Multiple qualifiers can be used to precisely identify a specific build

edge_cases.handling: Recipe and package revisions are represented as rrev and prev qualifiers
edge_cases.purl_impact: Allows precise reference to specific revisions of packages

do_not_assume: All Conan packages have a vendor
Package names can contain any characters
User and channel are always required
All packages have the same build configuration
key_facts_to_remember: Vendor is optional for conan packages
User and channel are optional qualifiers
Build options are represented as qualifiers
common_mistakes_to_avoid: Forgetting to include the version component
Using invalid characters in package names
Omitting required qualifiers when they are needed
Using incorrect format for revision qualifiers

examples.description: OpenSSL package with vendor, user, and channel
OpenSSL package with full build configuration and revisions

incorrect_examples.description: Missing package name component - name is required for conan
Missing version component - version is required for conan
Empty version component - version cannot be empty
Empty user qualifier - if provided, user must have a value
incorrect_examples.violation: qualifiers_definition.user requires a value when present

incorrect_examples.description: Empty channel qualifier - if provided, channel must have a value
incorrect_examples.violation: qualifiers_definition.channel requires a value when present

note: Additional qualifiers can be used to distinguish Conan packages with different settings or options, e.g. os=Linux, build_type=Debug or shared=True. If no additional qualifiers are used to distinguish Conan packages build with different settings or options, then the purl is ambiguous and it is up to the user to work out which package is being referred to (e.g. with context information).
